numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A student can have a higher income.
2. If a student has a higher income then the student has a significantly higher chance of being accepted into a college.
3. A parent of a student can have attended a college.
4. If a parent of a student has attended the college then the student has a higher chance of being accepted into the college.
5. We wonder why colleges find money more valuable than knowledge.
7. This situation relates to our community.
8. We will compete for college acceptance.
9. We will compete with people of wealth for college acceptance.
10. We will compete with people of priority for college acceptance.
11. A kid can be a Valor kid.
12. We ask whether a Valor kid has ever truly been accepted.
